com.tokelon.toktales.core.render.order

Interface IRenderLayerStack

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RenderLayerStack

    public interface IRenderLayerStack
    A continuous list of render calls ordered by the positions they have been assigned to.

    Double values are used for positions, which allows for calls to be placed in between other calls indefinitely. Both positive and negative values are valid positions. The position 0.0 is thought as the main call, but has no special function.
    The smallest position is considered the lowest and therefore the first in priority.

    The underlying implementation must ensure thread safety internally for calls and externally for iterations when synchronized on this object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IRenderLayerStack.IStackNavigator
      Can be used to navigate through the positions of a stack.

    • Method Detail

      • addCallbackAt

        void addCallbackAt(double position,
                   IRenderCallback callback)
        Adds the given position to the stack and assigns the given callback to it.

        Any double value, positive or negative is a valid position. Unless you are positioning in between calls it is recommended to use integer values.
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the callback should be placed at.
        callback - The callback.

      • removeCallbackAt

        boolean removeCallbackAt(double position)
        Beware that the given value must match exactly the position value for the callback you are trying to remove.
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        True if the position was removed, or false if there was no change.

      • getCallbackAt

        IRenderCallback getCallbackAt(double position)
        Beware that the given value must match exactly the position value for the callback you are trying to remove.
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        The callback for the given positions, or null if there is none.

      • getCallbacks

        Collection<IRenderCallback> getCallbacks()
        Note that when iterating over the returned collection you must synchronize on this object to ensure thread safety.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable collection containing all callbacks sorted from lowest to highest position.

      • getPositions

        Collection<Double> getPositions()
        Note that when iterating over the returned collection you must synchronize on this object to ensure thread safety.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable collection containing all positions sorted from lowest to highest.

      • getLowerPosition

        double getLowerPosition(double position)
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        The greatest position less than the given one.

      • getHigherPosition

        double getHigherPosition(double position)
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        The lowest position greater than the given one.

      • getLowestPosition

        double getLowestPosition()
        Returns:
        The smallest value for positions which also has the highest priority.

      • getHighestPosition

        double getHighestPosition()
        Returns:
        The biggest value for positions which also has the lowest priority.

      • getStackSize

        int getStackSize()
        Returns:
        The number of callbacks for this stack.

      • navigator

        IRenderLayerStack.IStackNavigator navigator()
        Returns:
        A new navigator for this stack.
